verse: Rid yourselves, therefore, of all malice, and all deceit, hypocrisy, and envy, and all slander.
Like newborn infants, long for pure spiritual milk, so that by it you may advance on the path to salvation,
now that you have tasted that the Lord is good.
The Mystery of the Church. Come to him, a living stone, rejected by men but chosen by God and precious.
You, too, are like living stones, being built up into a spiritual temple and a holy priesthood to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

Therefore, it is precious to you who believe. However, for those who do not believe,

But you are “a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people claimed by God as his own possession,” so that you may proclaim the praise of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
Lead a Good Life amidst Pagans. Beloved, I urge you as aliens and exiles not to succumb to the desires of the flesh that wage war against the soul.
Conduct yourselves honorably among the Gentiles so that, although they now malign you as evildoers, they may observe your good works and glorify God on the day of visitation.
Christianity Is Not a Subversive Group. For the Lord’s sake, submit to every human institution, whether of the emperor as supreme
or of governors as sent by him to punish those who do wrong and to commend those who do good works.
For it is the will of God that by doing right you should silence the ignorant talk of fools.
As servants of God, behave as free people, but do not use your freedom as a means to cover up wrongdoing.
Give due honor to everyone. Love your fellow believers. Fear God. Honor the emperor.
Recommendations for Slaves. Slaves, submit to your masters with due respect, not only to those who are kind and forbearing but also to those who are harsh.
It is a sign of grace if you endure the pain of unjust suffering because of your awareness of God.
What credit do you deserve if you are patient when you are beaten for doing wrong? However, if you are patient when you do what is right and suffer for it, you have earned merit with God.
This, in fact, is what you have been called to do, because Christ himself suffered for you and left an example for you to follow in his footsteps.
When he was abused, he did not retaliate. When he suffered, he made no threats, but he placed his trust in the one who judges justly.
He himself bore our sins in his body on the cross, so that we might die to sin and live in righteousness.
